name: Pumpkin Mousse Cake with Spelt Vanilla Sponge
description: Elevate your holiday table with this impressive yet easy Vegan Pumpkin Mousse Cake. A layer of vanilla sponge cake made with spelt flour, topped with another layer of luscious pumpkin mousse. Allergen Information: Free of dairy, egg, soy, yeast.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup ground raw sugar (2 Tbsp more for sweeter)
1/3 cup oil (use a combination of oils. I use half organic canola and half coconut)
1/3 cup coconut milk or almond milk
1 Tbsp vinegar (I used apple cider vinegar)
1.5 tsp pumpkin pie spiceÂ  (or add 1/2 tsp cinnamon & ginger, 1/4 tsp clove & nutmeg)
1 Tbsp cornstarch mixed in 2 Tbsp water
1/2 cup coconut cream or full fall coconut milk

itemListElement.text: In a bowl, mix flax meal and water. Let sit for 2 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients under wet and mix well to combine.
itemListElement.name: In a bowl, mix flax meal and water. Let sit for 2 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients under wet and mix well to combine.

itemListElement.text: In another bowl, mix all the dry ingredients well. Add dry to wet and mix just till combined.
itemListElement.name: In another bowl, mix all the dry ingredients well. Add dry to wet and mix just till combined.

itemListElement.text: Pour this thick batter onto greased 8-inch cake pan. Bake at pre-heated 365 degrees F for 35-40 minutes, until toothpick from the center comes out clean,
itemListElement.name: Pour this thick batter onto greased 8-inch cake pan. Bake at pre-heated 365 degrees F for 35-40 minutes, until toothpick from the center comes out clean,

itemListElement.text: Let the cake cool a bit, then remove from pan. Slice the cake into 2 and clean up the edges or the bottom if you like. You can make the cake a day early and leave it at room temperature in an airtight container.
itemListElement.name: Let the cake cool a bit, then remove from pan. Slice the cake into 2 and clean up the edges or the bottom if you like. You can make the cake a day early and leave it at room temperature in an airtight container.

itemListElement.text: In a pan, heat almond milk at medium heat. Add agar powder to it and whisk well. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Add warmed pumpkin puree, spices, salt, sugar, cornstarch, and vanilla extract and whisk well. Cook for 5-6 minutes so the cornstarch gets cooked. Let the pumpkin mixture set in the refrigerator for a few hours. It will be like a well-set gel.
itemListElement.name: In a pan, heat almond milk at medium heat. Add agar powder to it and whisk well. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Add warmed pumpkin puree, spices, salt, sugar, cornstarch, and vanilla extract and whisk well. Cook for 5-6 minutes so the cornstarch gets cooked. Let the pumpkin mixture set in the refrigerator for a few hours. It will be like a well-set gel.

itemListElement.text: Blend the pumpkin gel with 2/3 cup coconut cream in a blender. Taste and adjust spice and sugar. Add 1/4 cup or more or less sugar if needed and blend. (To get coconut cream, refrigerate full-fat coconut milk cans for a few hours, then remove the accumulated cream from top).
itemListElement.name: Blend the pumpkin gel with 2/3 cup coconut cream in a blender. Taste and adjust spice and sugar. Add 1/4 cup or more or less sugar if needed and blend. (To get coconut cream, refrigerate full-fat coconut milk cans for a few hours, then remove the accumulated cream from top).

itemListElement.text: Spread this mousse between the 2 cake layers. Even it out, then wrap the cake in cling wrap and place in the 8-inch cake pan in the refrigerator for a few hours. Remove from refrigerator, unwrap and prep for frosting.
itemListElement.name: Spread this mousse between the 2 cake layers. Even it out, then wrap the cake in cling wrap and place in the 8-inch cake pan in the refrigerator for a few hours. Remove from refrigerator, unwrap and prep for frosting.

itemListElement.text: I made the frosting with the remaining mousse, but you can make any fall spiced or plain frosting of choice.
itemListElement.name: I made the frosting with the remaining mousse, but you can make any fall spiced or plain frosting of choice.

itemListElement.text: Blend the remaining mousse with about 1/2 cup coconut cream and rum extract until smooth.
itemListElement.name: Blend the remaining mousse with about 1/2 cup coconut cream and rum extract until smooth.

itemListElement.text: Evenly spread the pumpkin pie spiced coconut cream frosting on the cake on the sides and top. Sprinkle a little cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice on top through a sieve.
itemListElement.name: Evenly spread the pumpkin pie spiced coconut cream frosting on the cake on the sides and top. Sprinkle a little cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice on top through a sieve.

itemListElement.text: Slice and serve, or just eat all of it.
itemListElement.name: Slice and serve, or just eat all of it.

itemListElement.text: Or make the cake and the mousse and serve it up as parfaits.
itemListElement.name: Or make the cake and the mousse and serve it up as parfaits.

keywords: easy pumpkin cake recipe, mousse cake recipe, pumpkin mousse recipe
